subject: p17392550
Findings: CHEST, SINGLE AP PORTABLE VIEW. The lungs are hyperinflated, consistent with COPD. The patient is status post sternotomy. Heart size is at the upper limits of normal or slightly enlarged. The pulmonary hila are slightly prominent with a tapered configuration, which could reflect pulmonary hypertension. There is biapical fibronodular scarring, probably with retraction of the hila. No CHF, focal consolidation or effusion is identified.
